channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mexico Elects First Female President, and Hunter Biden Goes on Trial
item.description: Plus, Simone Biles sets a record.

item.title: Claudia Sheinbaum Will Be Mexico’s First Jewish President
item.description: Claudia Sheinbaum was born to Jewish parents, but she has played down her heritage on the campaign trail.

item.title: Managers are puzzled by Gen Zers as giving feedback becomes a lost art in the era of the 'coddled mind'
item.description: We may have lost sight of the old saying, 'Prepare the child for the road, not the road for the child.'

item.title: In Former Soviet States, a Tug of War Between East and West
item.description: Geopolitical rivalry, intensified by fighting in Ukraine, is amplifying domestic struggles in countries like Georgia and Moldova whose people are split on which side to support.

item.title: What to Know About Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico’s Newly Elected President
item.description: Here are five key insights into Mexico’s new president as people wonder whether she will diverge from Andrés Manuel López Obrador’s policies or focus on cementing his legacy.

item.title: Airbus CEO blames U.S. for trade wars rather than China in old Boeing flare-up
item.description: "I want to remind you that in recent years, it was not the Chinese who imposed tariffs on European aircraft, but the Americans,” Guillaume Faury said.

item.title: Mexico Elects Claudia Sheinbaum as First Woman to Lead Country
item.description: A climate scientist and former mayor, Ms. Sheinbaum became the first woman and Jewish person elected as president of the country.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel’s Offensive in Southern Gaza Strains Ties With Egypt
item.description: The Israeli military’s operation in Rafah, on the Egyptian border, risks upsetting a delicate peace that has been a pillar of its national security for decades.

item.title: Toyota halts sales of 3 cars after submitting faulty data during pedestrian-safety tests
item.description: Toyota said shipment halts will affect two assembly lines responsible for the production of 130,000 units a year.

item.title: Time Flies When You’re Being Convicted
item.description: Is it still true that there’s no such thing as bad publicity?

item.title: In Myanmar, a New Threat for the Rohingya
item.description: Allegations against the Arakan Army, a key force in the fight against the junta, threaten to revive old horrors of sectarian atrocities.

item.title: Capital One Miles: Everything you need to know in 2024
item.description: As a credit card rewards program, Capital One Miles may have too many vexing shortcomings for the average consumer—but a niche type of traveler may find it perfect.

item.title: Fauci to Face Grilling by Republican Committee on Covid Origins
item.description: Over 15 months, a House panel has not linked Dr. Fauci to the beginnings of the pandemic. But it found emails suggesting aides were skirting public records laws.

item.title: In Former Soviet States, a Tug of War Between East and West
item.description: Geopolitical rivalry, intensified by fighting in Ukraine, is amplifying domestic struggles in countries like Georgia and Moldova whose people are split on which side to support.

item.title: GameStop shares jump 103% as meme stock Reddit driver DeepF— Value posted an apparent $116 million position
item.description: The June 2 screenshot by Keith Gill, who goes by DeepF— Value on Reddit, shows five million shares bought at $21.27 per share.
